body: Without seeing a log file/command/etc it's really tough to see what's going on. It's best to try to copy that one file and produce the output rather than running a whole sync.

Is it every file for you or just certain ones?

```
felix@gemini:~$ rclone copy GD:test.xlsx . -vv
2021/07/09 13:24:46 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/07/09 13:24:46 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.55.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "GD:test.xlsx" "." "-vv"]

I'm going to put up a "me too" on this one:

<!-- **STOP and  READ** **USE THIS TEMPLATE. YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put in to solving the problem and please be specific -- people are volunteering their time to help you! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!   **DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.  You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.  Or use a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/   -->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I can no longer download a certain google sheets document from google drive. Everything worked properly until 2 days ago when suddenly I started getting errors with this sheets file. All other files copy fine (including other google sheets documents), and this same file copied fine 3 days ago. 

Any help would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
<!-- **STOP and  READ**: Are you on the latest version of rclone? You can validate by checking the version listed here: https://rclone.org/downloads/
 -->
rclone v1.55.1
#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS (64 bit)

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)  
<!--  You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.   -->

```
rclone -vv copy gdrive:/Financials.xlsx .
```


#### The rclone config contents with secrets removed.  
<!--  You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.   -->

```
[gdrive]
type = drive
client_id = 
client_secret = 
token = {"access_token":"****REDACTED****","token_type":"Bearer","refresh_token":"****REDACTED****","expiry":"2021-07-09T11:16:29.387355534-06:00"}
```

@animosity22 just this one file. Lots of files work just fine:

```
2021/07/09 20:41:19 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: Only files with binary content can be downloaded. Use Export with Docs Editors files., fileNotDownloadable
2021/07/09 20:41:19 INFO  :
Transferred:             0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (retrying may help)
Checks:              2265 / 2265, 100%
Elapsed time:        56.0s
```

```
2021/07/09 20:41:17 ERROR : XXX: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: Only files with binary content can be downloaded. Use Export with Docs Editors files., fileNotDownloadable
```

Is it normal that the filename printed in this error does not contain the `.xlsx` extension? All other debug prints seem to contain `.xlsx` extension for Google Sheets files.

Based on the modification time of the file, the last time this failing file was succesfully copied is:

```
-rw-r--r-- 1 hoxu hoxu 195460 2021-07-07 23:41:39.439000000 +0300 'XXX.xlsx'
```

Something changed in the Google Drive API recently?

FWIW, the filename also contains `/` (slash) in Google Drive, but it's returned as `／`.

Same issue here, rclone suddenly started showing this error on spreadsheets (documents are fine) about 48 hours ago:

```
2021/07/10 15:13:14 ERROR : [filename]: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: open file failed: googleapi: Error 403: Only files with binary content can be downloaded. Use Export with Docs Editors files., fileNotDownloadable
```

I haven't changed anything on my side and I've synchronised this file every day for over a month without any problems. There hasn't been any drastic change to the file in the meantime.

I was running 1.50.2 (latest Ubuntu LTS) but upgraded to 1.55.1 - no change.

It's probably best to run one copy and grab the --dump headers,requests on it and share that. I'm not sure if there is something super personal in that info or not offhand and  you can tag it to @ncw and reference this issue as that should have the needed debug information to see what's changed or what is different about those files.

Perhaps one that works and one that doesn't work.

Same issue here, some selected gSheets giving the reported error.
Looking at similar files, I've noted that the erratic one has a size value (like 50K).

*Workaround*
Just make a copy of the gSheet on gDrive.
The new copy doesn't have size allocated and works flawlessly with `rclone`.

Hope it helps.
That workaround fixed the problem for me as well, I made a copy, deleted the original, renamed the copy to match the original and a sync worked.
Same issue for me also, with a recently modified sheet. This particular sheet showed a size value - as reported by @lulis and his suggested workaround worked for me also.

This has started happening again and it's affecting even more files now - previously I thought it was confined to spreadsheets but it is now affecting Word documents and PDFs. The only thing I can think of is that it seems to affect recently opened / edited files (as in the last hour or so), but I don't know if that's a coincidence.

Full output with `--verbose` and `--dump headers` (names and paths redacted as they contain third party details):

rclone version:

```
$ rclone version
rclone v1.55.1
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: 386
- go/version: go1.16.3
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

> The only thing I can think of is that it seems to affect recently opened / edited files (as in the last hour or so), but I don't know if that's a coincidence.

My failing file has usually been modified during last 24 hours, but since my cronjob runs at night, never during last hour. I don't think modification time affects this issue.

Does the rclone project have any contacts to Google? This seems like an issue with Google Drive API.

Reading the error message carefully

> Error 403: Only files with binary content can be downloaded. Use Export with Docs Editors files., fileNotDownloadable

So what it is saying is that `rclone` tried to download a google doc in the normal way, instead of exporting it like it usually does.

What I really need to see is what google is returning for the document listing to see why rclone isn't detecting it as a document properly.

Could you do

    rclone lsf -vv --dump bodies drive:path/to/file.xlsx --log-file rclone.log

And paste or attach the rclone.log please @hoxu and @pwaring ?

@ncw:

I can't run `lsf` for only the problematic file, probably because of the `/` in the filename (in hindsight a bad idea, but it has worked before and I don't want to rename it now until we are done debugging), but `lsf googledrive:` seems to return the file.

I don't have time to read and redact the whole log now, but here is what is returned for the file in JSON, formatted with `jq .`:
